CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Based on the definition , J ph equals to the difference between the current density of devices under 100 mW cm^-2 ( J L ) and that in the dark ( J D ). V eff = V 0 - V , where V 0 is the voltage at which J L = J D and V is the applied voltage. When the reverse voltage is greater than 2 V , recombination will be suppressed because of a high internal electric field and thus the current density becomes saturated ( J sat ). Consequently , P(E,T) = J ph / J sat could be used to describe the charge dissociation probability. The charge dissociation probability of PffBB-10 , PffBB-12 , PffBB-14 , and PffBB-16 - based cells was estimated to be 0.86 , 0.94 , 0.98 , and 0.92 , respectively. The highest exciton dissociation of the PffBB-14 - based device is anticipated to give rise to the best photovoltaic performance among these series of polymers. Figure 7 demonstrates the dependence of V oc and J sc against light intensity , which could be used to describe the recombination process in BHJ films. The V oc is directly proportional to the incident light intensity in the semilogarithmic plot with a slope of kT / q , which describes bimolecular recombination in the BHJ film , where k represents the Boltzmann constant , T is the Kelvin temperature , and q is the elementary charge. Trap - assisted recombination exists if the slope is larger than kT / q. 42 Among devices fabricated , the PffBB-14 - based cell exhibited the smallest slope of 1.10 kT / q , suggesting the least trap - assisted recombination. Bimolecular recombination was also investigated by measuring the dependence of J sc against light intensity , in which the exponential factor α in the power law of J sc ∝ P light α is used Article to indicate bimolecular recombination in the BHJ film. The closer the estimated α to 1.0 , the weaker the bimolecular recombination occurs in the device. 43 Obviously , with α = 0.98 , the PffBB-14 - based device would exhibit the least occurrence of bimolecular recombination in the active layer. In contrast , the PffBB-10 - based device showed an α value of 0.86 , indicating that the bimolecular recombination loss was severe in its BHJ film. These results consistently indicate that the PffBB-14:PC71BM blend with superior balanced charge carrier transport exhibits the least recombination loss among PffBBn : PC71BM - based PSCs , thus affording the highest J sc and FF. Morphology of the Active Layer. AFM images of PffBBn : PC71BM blended thin films were obtained to investigate their microphase separation behavior and the corresponding AFM height and phase images recorded in the tapping mode are shown in Figure 8. Good miscibility could be observed in all of the PffBB-n:PC71BM blended thin films , which gives rise to desirable phase separation.

Let's think step by step.

1. J ph (Junction photocurrent)
2. J L (Current density under 100 mW cm^-2)
3. J D (Current density in the dark)
4. J sat (Saturated current density)
5. PffBB-10, PffBB-12, PffBB-14, PffBB-16 (Material names of the polymers)
6. V oc (Open circuit voltage)
7. J sc (Short circuit current)
8. BHJ films (Blend of Hole Transporting and P-type doped materials with a p-type semiconductor)
9. k (Boltzmann constant)
10. T (Kelvin temperature)
11. q (Elementary charge)
12. PffBB-14 based cell (Material name of the cell)
13. Trap-assisted recombination
14. PffBB-10 based device (Material name of the device)
15. α (Exponential factor in the power law of J sc)
16. PC71BM (Material name of the fullerene derivative)
17. PffBBn : PC71BM blended thin films (Material names of the blended films)

* J L (Current density under 100 mW cm^-2)
* J D (Current density in the dark)
* J sat (Saturated current density)
* V oc (Open circuit voltage)
* J sc (Short circuit current)
* BHJ films (Blend of Hole Transporting and P-type doped materials with a p-type semiconductor)

Paragraph: Based on the definition , J ph equals to the difference between the current density of devices under 100 mW cm^-2 ( J L ) and that in the dark ( J D ). V eff = V 0 - V , where V 0 is the voltage at which J L = J D and V is the applied voltage. When the reverse voltage is greater than 2 V , recombination will be suppressed because of a high internal electric field and thus the current density becomes saturated ( J sat ). Consequently , P(E,T) = J ph / J sat could be used to describe the charge dissociation probability. The charge dissociation probability of PffBB-10 , PffBB-12 , PffBB-14 , and PffBB-16 - based cells was estimated to be 0.86 , 0.94 , 0.98 , and 0.92 , respectively. The highest exciton dissociation of the PffBB-14 - based device is anticipated to give rise to the best photovoltaic performance among these series of polymers. Figure 7 demonstrates the dependence of V oc and J sc against light intensity , which could be used to describe the recombination process in BHJ films. The V oc is directly proportional to the incident light intensity in the semilogarithmic plot with a slope of kT / q , which describes bimolecular recombination in the BHJ film , where k represents the Boltzmann constant , T is the Kelvin temperature , and q is the elementary charge. Trap - assisted recombination exists if the slope is larger than kT / q. 42 Among devices fabricated , the PffBB-14 - based cell exhibited the smallest slope of 1.10 kT / q , suggesting the least trap - assisted recombination. Bimolecular recombination was also investigated by measuring the dependence of J sc against light intensity , in which the exponential factor α in the power law of J sc ∝ P light α is used Article to indicate bimolecular recombination in the BHJ film. The closer the estimated α to 1.0 , the weaker the bimolecular recombination occurs in the device. 43 Obviously , with α = 0.98 , the PffBB-14 - based device would exhibit the least occurrence of bimolecular recombination in the active layer. In contrast , the PffBB-10 - based device showed an α value of 0.86 , indicating that the bimolecular recombination loss was severe in its BHJ film. These results consistently indicate that the PffBB-14:PC71BM blend with superior balanced charge carrier transport exhibits the least recombination loss among PffBBn : PC71BM - based PSCs , thus affording the highest J sc and FF. AFM images of PffBBn : PC71BM blended thin films were obtained to investigate their microphase separation behavior and the corresponding AFM height and phase images recorded in the tapping mode are shown in Figure 8. Good miscibility could be observed in all of the PffBB-n:PC71BM blended thin films , which gives rise to desirable phase separation.

Let's think step by step.

1. J ph: Junction photocurrent
2. J L: Current density under 100 mW cm^-2
3. J D: Current density in the dark
4. V eff: Effective voltage
5. V 0: Voltage at which J L = J D
6. J sat: Saturated current density
7. P(E,T): Charge dissociation probability
8. PffBB-10, PffBB-12, PffBB-14, PffBB-16: Types of cells
9. k: Boltzmann constant
10. T: Kelvin temperature
11. q: Elementary charge
12. V oc: Open circuit voltage
13. J sc: Short circuit current
14. α: Exponential factor in the power law of J sc
15. bimolecular recombination: Recombination process in BHJ films
16. trap-assisted recombination: Type of recombination
17. slope: Slope in the semilogarithmic plot of V oc against light intensity
18. Figure 7: Demonstration of the dependence of V oc and J sc against light intensity
19. AFM: Atomic Force Microscopy
20. PffBBn: Type of polymer
21. PC71BM: Type of fullerene
22. morphology: Structure or form of the active layer
23. AFM images: Atomic Force Microscopy images
24. microphase separation behavior: Separation of different phases within a material
25. AFM height images: Images showing the height variations in the material
26. AFM phase images: Images showing the phase variations in the material
27. Figure 8: Demonstration of AFM height and phase images of PffBBn : PC71BM blended thin films.

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Based on the definition , J ph equals to the difference between the current density of devices under 100 mW cm^-2 ( J L ) and that in the dark ( J D ). V eff = V 0 - V , where V 0 is the voltage at which J L = J D and V is the applied voltage. When the reverse voltage is greater than 2 V , recombination will be suppressed because of a high internal electric field and thus the current density becomes saturated ( J sat ). Consequently , P(E,T) = J ph / J sat could be used to describe the charge dissociation probability. The charge dissociation probability of PffBB-10 , PffBB-12 , PffBB-14 , and PffBB-16 - based cells was estimated to be 0.86 , 0.94 , 0.98 , and 0.92 , respectively. The highest exciton dissociation of the PffBB-14 - based device is anticipated to give rise to the best photovoltaic performance among these series of polymers. Figure 7 demonstrates the dependence of V oc and J sc against light intensity , which could be used to describe the recombination process in BHJ films. The V oc is directly proportional to the incident light intensity in the semilogarithmic plot with a slope of kT / q , which describes bimolecular recombination in the BHJ film , where k represents the Boltzmann constant , T is the Kelvin temperature , and q is the elementary charge. Trap - assisted recombination exists if the slope is larger than kT / q. 42 Among devices fabricated , the PffBB-14 - based cell exhibited the smallest slope of 1.10 kT / q , suggesting the least trap - assisted recombination. Bimolecular recombination was also investigated by measuring the dependence of J sc against light intensity , in which the exponential factor α in the power law of J sc ∝ P light α is used Article to indicate bimolecular recombination in the BHJ film. The closer the estimated α to 1.0 , the weaker the bimolecular recombination occurs in the device. 43 Obviously , with α = 0.98 , the PffBB-14 - based device would exhibit the least occurrence of bimolecular recombination in the active layer. In contrast , the PffBB-10 - based device showed an α value of 0.86 , indicating that the bimolecular recombination loss was severe in its BHJ film. These results consistently indicate that the PffBB-14:PC71BM blend with superior balanced charge carrier transport exhibits the least recombination loss among PffBBn : PC71BM - based PSCs , thus affording the highest J sc and FF. Morphology of the Active Layer. AFM images of PffBBn : PC71BM blended thin films were obtained to investigate their microphase separation behavior and the corresponding AFM height and phase images recorded in the tapping mode are shown in Figure 8. Good miscibility could be observed in all of the PffBB-n:PC71BM blended thin films , which gives rise to desirable phase separation.

Let's think step by step.

1. J ph: The difference between the current density of devices under 100 mW cm^-2 (J L) and that in the dark (J D), no unit given in the paragraph.
2. V eff: Difference between V 0 and V, volts (V).
3. J sat: Current density when reverse voltage is greater than 2 V and recombination is suppressed, no unit given in the paragraph.
4. P(E,T): Charge dissociation probability, no unit given in the paragraph.
5. PffBB-10, PffBB-12, PffBB-14, PffBB-16: Charge dissociation probability of these cells, dimensionless (0.86, 0.94, 0.98, 0.92).
6. k: Boltzmann constant, Joules per Kelvin (J/K).
7. T: Kelvin temperature, Kelvin (K).
8. q: Elementary charge, Coulombs (C).
9. V oc: Open circuit voltage, volts (V).
10. J sc: Short circuit current density, Amperes per square centimeter (A/cm^2).
11. α: Exponential factor in the power law of J sc ∝ P light α, dimensionless.
12. kT: Product of Boltzmann constant and Kelvin temperature, Joules (J).

| Property Value |
|---------------|
| J ph (J L - J D) | Unknown |
| V eff (V 0 - V) | Volts |
| J sat | Unknown |
| P(E,T) | Dimensionless |
| PffBB-10: 0.86 | Dimensionless |
| PffBB-12: 0.94 | Dimensionless |
| PffBB-14: 0.98 | Dimensionless |
| PffBB-16: 0.92 | Dimensionless |
| k (Boltzmann constant) | J/K |
| T (Kelvin temperature) | Kelvin |
| q (Elementary charge) | Coulombs |
| V oc | Volts |
| J sc | Amperes per square centimeter |
| α | Dimensionless |
| kT/q | Joules |

Note: The values for J ph, V eff, and J sat are not explicitly stated in the paragraph, but they can be calculated based on the given information.
